title: Getting Started with Baseline Characteristics Table
text: baseline characteristic analysis aims provide tables summarize details participants. development baseline characteristic analysis involves functions: prepare_base_cha: prepare analysis raw datasets. format_base_char: prepare analysis (mock) outdata proper format. rtf_base_char: transfer (mock) output dataset RTF table.

title: Getting Started with Baseline Characteristics Table
code: adsl <- r2rtf::r2rtf_adsl adsl$TRTA <- adsl$TRT01A adsl$TRTA <- factor(   adsl$TRTA,   levels = c("Placebo", "Xanomeline Low Dose", "Xanomeline High Dose"),   labels = c("Placebo", "Low Dose", "High Dose") ) plan <- plan(   analysis = "base_char",   population = "apat",   observation = "apat",   parameter = "age;gender;race" ) meta <- meta_adam(population = adsl,                   observation = adsl) |>   define_plan(plan = plan) |>   define_population(     name = "apat",     group = "TRTA",     subset = quote(SAFFL == "Y"),     var = c("USUBJID", "TRTA", "SAFFL", "AGEGR1", "SEX", "RACE")   ) |>   define_parameter(     name = "age",     var = "AGE",     label = "Age (years)",     vargroup = "AGEGR1"   ) |>   define_parameter(name = "gender",                    var = "SEX",                    label = "Gender") |>   define_parameter(name = "race",                    var = "RACE",                    label = "Race") |>   define_analysis(name = "base_char",                   title = "Participant Baseline Characteristics by Treatment Group",                   label = "baseline characteristic table") |>   meta_build()

title: Getting Started with Baseline Characteristics Table
text: input function prepare_base_char_subgroup() meta object created metalite package. output function outdata object containing list analysis raw datasets. Key arguments : subgroup_var: character value subgroup variable name observation data saved meta$data_observation. subgroup_header: character vector column header hierarchy. first element first level header second element second level header. output dataset contains commonly used statistics within subgroup_var. information subgroup saved outdata$group outdata$subgroup. n_pop: participants population within subgroup_var.
code: meta <- meta_sl_example() outdata <- prepare_base_char_subgroup(   meta,   population = "apat",   parameter = "age",   subgroup_var = "TRTA",   subgroup_header = c("SEX", "TRTA"),   display_subgroup_total = TRUE ) outdata$out_all$`Placebo` outdata$out_all$`High Dose` outdata$out_all$`Low Dose` outdata$group outdata$subgroup outdata$out_all$`Placebo`$n outdata$out_all$`High Dose`$n outdata$out_all$`Low Dose`$n

title: Treatment Compliance
text: objective tutorial generate production-ready Treatment Compliance specification analyses. report produces table contains summary treatment compliance information. report consists treatment compliance category section treatment compliance statistics section. accomplish using metalite.sl, three essential functions required: -prepare_trt_compliance ():function wrapper function prepare_sl_summary () prepares data treatment compliance analysis. -format_trt_compliance(): prepare analysis outdata proper format. -rtf_trt_compliance(): transfer output dataset RTF table. example output:

title: Treatment Compliance
text: Within metalite.sl, utilized ADSL datasets metalite package create illustrative dataset. metadata structure remains consistent across analysis examples within metalite.sl. calculate treatment compliance percent treatment compliance range, utilized adex dataset. Additional information can accessed metalite package website.

title: Treatment Compliance
code: adsl <- r2rtf::r2rtf_adsl  adex <- metalite.ae::metalite_ae_adex  adex1 <- adex |>   filter(EXNUMDOS > 0 & !(is.na(AENDY))) |>   group_by(USUBJID) |>   slice(n()) |>   select(USUBJID, AENDY) |>   rename(ADURN = AENDY)  adsl <- merge(adsl, adex1, by = "USUBJID")  adsl <- adsl |>   mutate(     TRTDUR = as.numeric(TRTDUR),     ADURN = as.numeric(ADURN),     CMPLPCT = round((ADURN / TRTDUR) * 100, 2)   )  adsl <- adsl |>   mutate(     CMPLRNG = case_when(       CMPLPCT >= 0 & CMPLPCT <= 20 ~ "0% to <=20%",       CMPLPCT > 20 & CMPLPCT <= 40 ~ ">20% to <=40%",       CMPLPCT > 40 & CMPLPCT
